definition[0]: to start talking again about something that happened a long time ago, especially something unpleasant
example[0]: Newsweek magazine dredged up some remarks which he made last year.
definition[1]: to manage to remember something, or to feel or express an emotion, with difficulty
example[1]: Robertson tried to dredge up an image of her in his mind.
example[2]: From somewhere she dredged up a brilliant smile.
definition[2]: to pull something up from the bottom of a river, lake etc
